Package gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.jfreechart

Provides support for generating JFreeChart diagrams from reports generated by Aggregator.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Chart A chart based on JFreeChart.
ChartFactory A factory that can create various types of JFreeChart charts.
Datasets Utility class that adapts diagrams to JFreeChart datasets.
 

Package gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.jfreechart Description

Provides support for generating JFreeChart diagrams from reports generated by Aggregator.

Package Specification

JFreeChart is a Java library that specializes in creating charts. These can be drawn on a Graphics object, stored to a file (for example, as a JPEG), or embedded in a Swing application.

To see an example of this package expected usage, assume this preparation exists (which is explained in Aggregator): 

Aggregator aggregator = ...;
Records records = aggregator. ... report(...);
Diagram diagram = DiagramFactory.newDiagram(records)
    .withTitle("My Title")
    .withRangeLabel("Time (milliseconds)");
The root access point of this package is ChartFactory. Using this, a factory that can create various types of JFreeChart charts is created. 
ChartFactory chartFactory = new ChartFactory(diagram);
For example, to create a bar chart: 
Chart chart = chartFactory.newBarChart();
Or to create a line chart: 
Chart chart = chartFactory.newLineChart();
A Chart object offers methods to an image of the chart, to paint the chart to a Graphics object, to save the chart into a file, to create a panel that can be embedded in a Swing application. See the respective javadocs for a complete specification.

For a simple example, this would be used to create a jpg from the chart: 

chart.write(800, 600, "jpeg", new File("myDiagram.jpg"));

To create a panel that can be embedded in a Swing container: 

ChartPanel panel = chart.newPanel();
